titleStmt.title: A most elegant and religious rapture composed by Mr. Samuel Ward (that sometime famous and pious pastor at Ipswich) during his Episcopal imprisonment in the Gate-House, and by him dedicated to King Charles the First. Now, most exactly Englished by John Vicars.
titleStmt.author: Ward, Samuel, 1577-1640.
Vicars, John, 1579 or 80-1652.

titleStmt.title: A most elegant and religious rapture composed by Mr. Samuel Ward (that sometime famous and pious pastor at Ipswich) during his Episcopal imprisonment in the Gate-House, and by him dedicated to King Charles the First. Now, most exactly Englished by John Vicars.
titleStmt.author: Ward, Samuel, 1577-1640.
Vicars, John, 1579 or 80-1652.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for Tho. Maxey, and are to be sold in Thames-street, neer St Benet Paul's Warf,

notesStmt.note: Parallel Latin and English verse - "Magnae Magnes, Me dignare,".
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
